means: 不悦之色，怒容( scowl的名词复数 )
怒视，生气地皱眉( scowl的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: All my attempts to amuse the children were met with sullen scowls.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想尽办法哄这些孩子玩儿,但是他们总是满脸不高兴.

sentence.Network_en: Frowns, scowls and grimaces all push people away -- but a smile draws them in. 1.
sentence.Network_cn: 愁眉苦脸只会把人推开, 而微笑却把人吸引过来.

list.abs: He was reading a newspaper and scowling heavily ., 他眉头紧锁地看着报纸.
Dixon scowled , then shrugged., 狄克逊愁容满面 , 然后耸耸肩膀.
scowl down sb . ' s gripe ., 瞪眼怒视使某人不敢再抱怨.

entry.def: When someone scowls, an angry or hostile expression appears on their face.

example.ex: He scowled, and slammed the door behind him...
She scowled at the two men as they entered the room.
example.tran: 两个男人进屋时，她怒目而视。

auth_sentence.content: "More pastry than filling, and too sweet," he scowls.
auth_sentence.res_content: "More pastry than filling, and too sweet," he scowls.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "More pastry than filling, and too sweet," he scowls.

auth_sentence.content: "He's very brusque and abrupt, and he kind of scowls a lot," says Lubchenco.
auth_sentence.res_content: "He's very brusque and abrupt, and he kind of scowls a lot," says Lubchenco.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "He's very brusque and abrupt, and he kind of scowls a lot," says Lubchenco.

auth_sentence.content: He smiles more than he scowls now, and the sinister dark glasses that he used to wear are gone.
auth_sentence.res_content: He smiles more than he scowls now, and the sinister dark glasses that he used to wear are gone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He smiles more than he scowls now, and the sinister dark glasses that he used to wear are gone.
